item.title: Web pentesting - Fundamentals
item.author: Author
item.description: The objective of a web pentest is to evaluate the security of web application by simulating a cyberattack. A little bit of context The auditor’s job can be separated into two main activities: identifying vulnerabilities (Vulnerability Assessment) and using them to perform a full penetration test (Pentest). Companies may request the services of an auditor only to run a Nessus (or OpenVAS) scan on an IP address range, without authorizing an actual intrusion.
